column1: Aalten (pronunciation ) is a municipality and a village in the eastern Netherlands. The former municipalities of Bredevoort (1818) and Dinxperlo (2005) have been merged with Aalten.
Notable inhabitants of Aalten include Angus Young
column2: guitarist of the Australian rock band AC/DC
column4: a professional road bicycle racer.  During World War II
column5: 51 of Aalten's 85 Jews were hidden by local non-Jews
column6: and thereby survived the war. According to the War and Resistance Museum in Aalten
column7: the village had the highest number of people in hiding during World War II. The village of approximately 13

column1: Aalten railway station serves Aalten and the surrounding area. There is a half-hourly service between Arnhem and Winterswijk
column2: which stops at this station. Arnhem railway station has services to Amsterdam
column8: Tilburg and to cities in Germany.

column1: Aalten also has an hourly bus service to Ruurlo and to Zelhem.
